work_unit.name: Systematic Baseline Validation
work_unit.description: Implement 17-test validation roadmap for qengine vs VectorBT exact matching, progressing from baseline to advanced features

phases.name: Baseline Execution
phases.description: Verify qengine matches VectorBT with zero transaction costs

phases.name: Transaction Fees
phases.description: Validate commission calculation across different fee structures

phases.name: Code Quality & Architecture
phases.description: Clean up test contamination and complete PrecisionManager integration discovered during Phase 2

phases.name: Slippage
phases.description: Validate slippage calculation and fill price adjustments

phases.name: Order Types
phases.description: Validate limit, stop, and stop-limit order execution

tasks.title: Test 1.3: Multiple Round Trips
tasks.description: Implement baseline test with 40 entry/exit pairs and 5-bar hold period. Validates rapid re-entry, position tracking, and FIFO trade pairing.
acceptance_criteria: All 40 round trips matched between qengine and VectorBT
tasks.notes: Copy test_1_2 template, adjust signals to entry_every=25, hold_bars=5

tasks.title: Test 2.1: Percentage Commission
tasks.description: Validate 0.1% percentage commission calculation. Gross PnL should match baseline, net PnL reduced by 0.2% per round trip.
tasks.notes: Copy test_1_3, change fees=0.001, verify commission calculation

tasks.title: Test 2.2: Fixed + Percentage Fees
tasks.description: Validate combined fee structure (0.1% + $2 per trade). Total commission = (notional * 0.001) + $2.
tasks.notes: May require wrapper changes to support combined fee model. Check VectorBT API.

tasks.title: Test 2.3: Asset-Specific Fees
tasks.description: Validate multi-asset test with different commission rates per asset (BTC: 0.1%, ETH: 0.05%).
tasks.notes: Requires multi-asset data generation and signal interleaving. May need wrapper enhancements.

tasks.title: Test 3.1: Fixed Slippage
tasks.description: Validate $10 fixed slippage per trade. BUY fills at price + $10, SELL fills at price - $10.
tasks.notes: Check if wrapper supports fixed slippage model. May need FixedSlippage class.

tasks.title: Test 3.2: Percentage Slippage
tasks.description: Validate 0.05% percentage slippage. BUY fills at price * 1.0005, SELL fills at price * 0.9995.
acceptance_criteria: Higher priced assets have higher $ slippage
tasks.notes: Similar to Test 2.1 but for slippage instead of fees

tasks.title: Test 3.3: Combined Fees + Slippage
tasks.description: Validate combined costs (0.1% commission + 0.05% slippage). Total cost ≈ 0.3% per round trip.
tasks.notes: Integration test for fees + slippage. Verify order of operations.

tasks.title: Test 4.1: Limit Orders
tasks.description: Validate limit order execution. Orders only fill when market reaches limit price (2% from market).
acceptance_criteria: No fills above BUY limit price
No fills below SELL limit price
tasks.notes: More complex execution logic. May need to adjust signal generation for limit orders.

tasks.title: Test 4.2: Stop Orders
tasks.description: Validate stop order execution. Orders trigger when market reaches stop price (5% below entry for longs).
acceptance_criteria: Stops trigger when price reaches stop level
Fill at next available price (may be worse than stop)
tasks.notes: Stop logic may differ between qengine and VectorBT. Document any differences.

tasks.title: Test 4.3: Stop-Limit Orders
tasks.description: Validate stop-limit execution. Two-stage: stop trigger → limit fill within price band.
acceptance_criteria: Fills only within limit price range
Order may not fill if price gaps past limit
tasks.notes: Most complex order type. May require significant debugging.

tasks.title: Test 5.1: Multi-Asset Portfolio
tasks.description: Validate concurrent positions in 3 assets (BTC, ETH, SOL) with independent tracking and no cross-contamination.
tasks.notes: Requires multi-asset data generation and interleaved signals. Similar to Test 2.3.

tasks.title: Test 5.2: Position Sizing
tasks.description: Validate dynamic position sizing (10% of equity per trade). Position size adjusts as equity changes.
acceptance_criteria: Position size varies per trade based on equity
Winners increase position size, losers decrease
tasks.notes: Requires position sizing logic in wrapper. Check if VectorBT size parameter handles this.

tasks.title: Test 5.3: Margin Trading
tasks.description: Validate 2x leverage with margin requirements and margin call enforcement. Can open positions up to 2x equity.
acceptance_criteria: Margin calls triggered correctly when equity falls below threshold
tasks.notes: Most complex test. qengine margin accounting may differ from VectorBT. Document differences.

tasks.title: Test 6.1: High-Frequency Trading
tasks.description: Validate 1000+ trades with rapid entry/exit (1-2 bar hold). Performance test: <5s execution, no memory leaks.
tasks.notes: Performance test. Use pytest benchmarking to measure execution time.

tasks.title: Test 6.2: Edge Cases
tasks.description: Validate handling of price gaps (10%+ moves), trading halts (missing bars), and corporate actions (splits, dividends).
acceptance_criteria: No crashes on price gaps (10%+ moves)
Graceful handling of trading halts (missing bars)
tasks.notes: Requires special data generator with gaps, halts, and corporate actions. Most complex data generation.

tasks.title: Move VectorBT Models to Validation Tests
tasks.description: Move VectorBTCommission, VectorBTInfiniteSizer, and VectorBTSlippage from production code (src/qengine) to validation test fixtures (tests/validation/models/). Total 319 lines of test-specific code to relocate.
acceptance_criteria: All validation tests updated to import from new locations
All validation tests still pass (test_2_1, test_2_2, etc.)
Production code has clear separation from test infrastructure
tasks.notes: Clean architectural separation. This is technical debt payoff - test-specific implementations should not live in production code.

tasks.title: Integrate PrecisionManager into PositionTracker
tasks.description: Add PrecisionManager to PositionTracker for rounding position quantities and cash updates (8 locations). This is the critical source-of-truth for all position state.
acceptance_criteria: All position quantity updates rounded via precision_mgr.round_quantity()
All cash impact calculations rounded via precision_mgr.round_cash()
Zero checks use precision_mgr.is_position_zero() instead of < 1e-9
Broker creates and injects PrecisionManager from AssetSpec
Validation tests still pass with same or better accuracy
No float drift in position tracking
tasks.notes: Most critical integration point. Position tracker is source of truth for all position state. Prevents float drift at the source.

tasks.title: Integrate PrecisionManager into Portfolio and Order
tasks.description: Add PrecisionManager to Portfolio (12 locations) for P&L accounting and Order (3 locations) for fill tracking. Prevents downstream float drift.
acceptance_criteria: All position quantity, cost_basis, cash, and P&L updates rounded
Validation tests accuracy improves or stays same
No P&L drift in portfolio accounting
tasks.notes: Portfolio and Order are downstream from PositionTracker. This prevents float drift from propagating to P&L calculations and fill tracking.

tasks.title: Complete PrecisionManager Integration and Test Buffer Elimination
tasks.description: Integrate PrecisionManager into TradeTracker (10+ locations), standardize commission model rounding, and test eliminating 0.9999x buffer with comprehensive rounding in place.
acceptance_criteria: TradeTracker rounds all P&L calculations (gross_pnl, net_pnl, entry_costs, exit_costs)
All commission models use PrecisionManager.round_cash() consistently
Manual round(x, 2) calls replaced with precision_mgr.round_cash()
Test buffer elimination: change cash * 0.9999 → cash in test wrappers
If buffer removal works: validation tests pass without workaround
If buffer still needed: document root cause clearly
Final validation: test_2_1 and test_2_2 still passing
tasks.notes: Final integration phase. TradeTracker is reporting layer, commission standardization ensures consistency. Buffer elimination would be ideal outcome but not required if root cause still exists.
